deIdi2b2.TEXT:
Record date: 2077-10-31
CCU Admit Note
Xayavong, Brandon MR# 7826250
Date of Admission: 10/30/77
Attending: Dr. Umphrey
ID/CC: 56yoM with anterior STEMI, s/p lysis, cath showing large LAD plaque
HPI: Mr Xayavong is a 56yoM with cardiac risk factors of DM, tobacco, HTN who presents from OSH with chest pain beginning at 10:30 the morning of admission. He says he doesn't remember what he was doing at the time, but was not engaged in strenuous activity. Describes diaphoresis , then 7/10 pain from left shoulder into left arm and chest. He took advil without effect. He presented to Carver Hospital, where he was found to have STE V2-5, Troponin I 0.05, CK 248, MB 2.8. He was started on full-dose integrilin, half-dose reteplase, and heparin gtt, transferred to GNC for emergent cath. LHC showed diffuse thrombotic LAD disease, no interventions. IABP placed, sent to CCU for further monitoring and management.
ROS: As above, otherwise negative in detail.
PMH:
DM2 x 8-9 years, non-insulin dependent
Tobacco use
HTN
Toe infection
Medications:
Glipizide 5 BID
Avandia 2mg QD
Lisinopril 5mg QD
Allergies: NKDA
SH: Patient lives in Lake Pocotopaug with wife. Justice of the peace. 2ppd x 40y, denies etoh.
FH: No early heart disease
Exam: VS: T= 98 HR= 70s BP= 130/70 RR= 14 SaO2= 99% 2L
General: NAD
HEENT: NC/AT, PERRL, anicteric. EOMI. OP w/ MMM, no erythema or injection.
Skin: No rashes
Neck: Supple, full ROM, JVP flat, 2+ carotids w/o bruits, no thyromegaly or nodules, no nodes
Chest: CTA&P bilaterally
CVS: RRR nl S1 S2, IABP in place
Abd: nl BS, soft, non-tender, no HSM
Extr: no c/c/e 2+ DP's bilaterally, no hematoma, no bruit
Neuro: AAOX3, MS nl, CN II through XII intact, Motor 5/5 UE and LE, Sensory intact. DTR's 2+ and symmetric in bilat LE and UE. Toes down bilaterally.
DATA:
Chemistry:
Plasma Sodium 137 (135-145) mmol/L
Plasma Potassium 4.4 (3.4-4.8) mmol/L
Plasma Chloride 105 (100-108) mmol/L
Plasma Carbon Dioxide 20.1 L (23.0-31.9) mmol/L
Calcium 8.5 (8.5-10.5) mg/dl
Phosphorus 2.9 (2.6-4.5) mg/dl
Magnesium 1.4 (1.4-2.0) meq/L
Plasma Urea Nitrogen 19 (8-25) mg/dl
Plasma Creatinine 1.0 (0.6-1.5) mg/dl
Plasma Glucose 245 H (70-110) mg/dl
Total Protein 6.3 (6.0-8.3) g/dl
Albumin 3.9 (3.3-5.0) g/dl
Globulin 2.4 L (2.6-4.1) g/dl
Direct Bilirubin 0.1 (0-0.4) mg/dl
Total Bilirubin 0.4 (0.0-1.0) mg/dl
Triglycerides 231 H (40-150) mg/dl
Cholesterol 135 mg/dl
High Density Lipoprotein 21 L (35-100) mg/dl
Low Density Lipoprotein 68 mg/dl
Cardiac Risk Ratio 6.4
Alkaline Phosphatase 72 (45-115) U/L
Transaminase-SGPT 38 (10-55) U/L
Creatine Kinase Isoenzymes PEND (0.0-6.9) ng/ml
CPK Isoenzymes Index PEND (0.0-3.5) %
Troponin-T PEND (0.00-0.09) ng/ml
Transaminase-SGOT 213 H (10-40) U/L
Creatine Kinase PEND (60-400) U/L
Heme:
WBC 12.7 H (4.5-11.0) th/cmm
HCT 38.7 L (41.0-53.0) %
HGB 13.6 (13.5-17.5) gm/dl
RBC 4.34 L (4.50-5.90) mil/cmm
PLT 218 (150-350) th/cumm
MCV 89 (80-100) fl
MCH 31.3 (26.0-34.0) pg/rbc
MCHC 35.1 (31.0-37.0) g/dl
RDW 13.3 (11.5-14.5) %
PT 14.9 H (11.3-13.3) sec
PT-INR 1.4
APTT 51.0 H (22.1-35.1) sec
DIFFERENTIAL REQUEST RECEIVED
Diff Method Auto
Poly 84 H (40-70) %
Lymphs 12 L (22-44) %
Monos 3 L (4-11) %
EOS 1 (0-8) %
Basos 0 (0-3) %
Urinalysis:
Pending
CXR: pending
EKG: NSR @ 79, 1mm STE V2-V4, Qs V1-3
Prelim echo: Anteroseptal and lateral hypokinesis, EF 30-40%, no significant valvular lesions.
___________________________________________
Impression: 56yoM with anterior STEMI, s/p half-dose lytics, s/p cath showing thrombotic prox LAD not intervened on. Now on IABP, chest-pain free.
Plan:
1. Ischemia
Will likely go back for repeat cath on Monday, possible LAD intervention
IABP 1:1 for now, with ancef prophylaxis
Keep on integrilin, heparin with close PTT monitoring
ASA
Holding on BB given decreased EF, some sinus pauses
Holding on statin for now, given transaminitis
Trending markers
2. Rhythm
D/c lidocaine, holding BB
Transcutaneous pacing pads
3. Pump
EF 30-40%, will likely re-echo later
Appears euvolemic
4. DM
Holding oral hypoglycemics
RISS
5. Prophylaxis
Heparin, Nexium
6. Dispo
Full Code
_________________________________
Charles Amaya, MD
Pager #36784
